nodes.text: Harte Secur was a major city on Naboo which was known for its nearby airbase, which trained some of the best pilots on Naboo. Several small settlements surrounded the city, such as a small base that was given several Palace Guard and a Research Center.

Harte Secur was a city on the planet Naboo, inhabited by the Human Naboo. It was surrounded by lines of trees water from the western, northern, and eastern sides. Most of Harte Secur's surface was paved with bricks, and the architecture was similar in style to Naboo's capital Theed. Three stone pathways led to the city from the south, and each was guarded by a pair of turrets. Between the western and central entrance there were three houses, a gazebo, a shield generator, and a power core.

The northwestern side of the city had buildings on the opposite sides of its path. The westernmost side had a tower, six houses, another power core, and a mech factory. The corner of that side of the city had a power core, a power station, and a troop center, as well as a temple and a house on a small grass-covered hill where flowers grew. The eastern side of that area of Harte Secur had a prefab shelter, a shield generator, a War Center with a power core and a turret next to it, two prefab shelters next to a heavy weapons factory, another power core, a troop center, a fortress, another power core and a Research Center. The center of Harte Secur was surrounded by walls in a rectangular formation, with a large archway leading into it. Inside it was a body of water surrounded by a fenced path. A total of six obelisks were placed in an even formation on both sides of the water. A command center was built at the top of the central portion of the city, with two turrets and two power cores on its sides. The area north fo the command center was covered with trees.

The eastern side of the city had three houses, a power core, two different types of turrets, and a mech factory, all on a paved area that ended as the ground to the north was elevated. The elevated area had a variety of trees and flowers, as well as a power core, and at its flat peak was another paved built up area. That area had, in clockwise order, a turret, two prefab shelters, another turret, a spaceport, a prefab shelter, two houses, and an airbase.

Multiple facilities associated with Harte Secur were located south of the city grounds. Directly south of the city was a base that contained a research center, two turrets, and a power core. The base was on a paved path and was surrounded by a light wall, with a gate on its eastern side. The gate was on a pathway that led northwards, eventually splitting off into the eastern and central entrances to Harte Secur. The river that surrounded Harte Secur flowed south on the western side of the city, surrounding the research base before flowing to the east. On the path to the western entrance to city there was a small fishing facility consisting of two shipyards, an animal nursery, a turret, a sentry post, and a power core. Five utility trawlers gathered fish from the river there. The wesetern path out of the city led down south to the Harte Secur Airbase, run by the Naboo Airforce. Several of Naboo's best pilots resided there. In the forest to the east of the city there was a hidden base belonging to the Gungans, an species indigenous to Naboo.
Following the attack by the Trade Federation during the Invasion of Naboo, Harte Secur was occupied by the Trade Federation Droid Army.

In 32 BBY, Naboo was invaded by the Trade Federation, and Harte Secur was fortified to prepare for a potential attack. The Trade Federation Droid Army established a camp directly south of Harte Secur. Early in the invasion, the Royal Naboo Security Forces team Force Command Two successfully captured a droid control program from the Trade Federation battle droid OOM-14. It was taken to the Harte Secur research base, where the program was used to deactivate OOM-14's forces at the nearby camp. Wary that the program could be duplicated and used to turn the Droid Army against him, Trade Federation Viceroy Nute Gunray tasked the B1-Series battle droid OOM-9 with retrieving the droid control program. OOM-9 was first sent to the Deactivated Camp, where he rendezvoused with a task force sent to retrieve the program, which included five droidekas, a bio cannon, and a Neimoidian technician.

The task force marched towards the research base using the eastern path, fighting groups of soldiers from Harte Secur that guarded the path, also using the bio cannons to destroy the turrets there. At the base, OOM-9 used the cannon to destroy the turrets there, with the droidekas protecting it from the Naboo troopers there. The technician retrieved the droid control program, after which the task force returned to the Deactivated Camp to reactivate the battle droids.
Harte Secur appears in both the Trade Federation and Gungan campaigns in the 2001 video game Star Wars: Galactic Battlegrounds.
